duties_responsibilities.duty: Utilize a high pressure water unit to clean various equipment such as process lines, heat exchanger tubes, condensers, and drains.
Assist in the set-up of equipment prior to operation and the actual cleaning operation utilizing various hoses, lances, nozzles, and water pressure up to 40,000 psi.
Assemble, adjust, and dismantle all high pressure cleaning equipment and accessories.
Follow all safety procedures and wear necessary personal protective equipment.
Operate and maintain hydroblasting cleaning unit to clean and unplug process equipment plant wide.
Drive a 2-ton truck used to transport the hydroblasting unit.
Read, understand, and follow all safety requirements, rules, and guidelines.
Use hand tools, power tools, and equipment.
Climb as necessary to reach the job and work from ladders, scaffolds, and platforms at elevated heights.
Perform work such as assembly, adjustment, and dismantlement of all hydroblasting cleaning equipment and accessories.
Troubleshoot equipment problems, make routine repairs, and inspect assigned equipment.
Concentrate on job tasks and perform computer training tasks using MyLearning Lab and Outlook.
Work in hazardous noise environments and be able to perform the essential elements of the positions with or without reasonable accommodations.
Work odd and unusual hours, including nights and weekends, and work considerable overtime.

education_certification.credential: Good writing, communication, and reading comprehension skills
